intro: Barleria prattensis, commonly known as red false brome, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces clusters of small, tubular red or orange flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Barleria prattensis is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides, where it blooms from late spring to early autumn.
